results.title: A Hole, a Tunnel, a 32-Yard Crawl: Palestinians Still Free After Jailbreak
results.abstract: A huge manhunt has failed to find six Palestinian prisoners who escaped an Israeli jail early on Monday morning.

results.title: A Vaccine Success in Europe That Sinks in the East

results.title: Belarus Opposition Leader Sentenced to 11 Years in Prison
results.abstract: The convictions of Maria Kolesnikova, a fierce opponent of President Aleksandr Lukashenko, and a colleague are part of a crackdown on dissent following a disputed election last year.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: The opposition figures Maria Kolesnikova and Maksim Znak at their hearing on Monday in Minsk, Belarus.

results.title: Chinese Social Media Site Suspends K-Pop Fan Accounts
results.abstract: Weibo accused one account devoted to a BTS member of illegal fund-raising amid a crackdown on 22 pages.

results.title: Taliban Claim Control Over Panjshir Valley, but Resistance Vows to Fight On
results.abstract: Militants posted images apparently taken in Bazarak, the capital of Panjshir Province in Afghanistan, where opposition forces have fought against their rule.
results.byline: By Sami Sahak, Wali Arian and Jim Huylebroek

results.title: A Personal Pilgrimage to a Downed Warplane in Papua New Guinea
results.abstract: Thirty-three years after his first visit to the site, a photographer traveled to a remote jungle in search of a World War II plane that crashed there in 1944.
